lg.l:
──────Cuicunque nocere volebat
Vestimenta dabat pretiosa.
Don Carlos in a merry Spight
Did Stella to his House invite,
He entertain'd her half a year
With richest Wines and costly Cheer:
Surpris'd with ev'ry day a hot meal
She thought that all the world was Oatmeal:

·\Marginal note evidently offers alternative lines to "That she might o're the Servants hector
Don Carlos made her sole Director":\Don Carlos made her chief Director_She now can or'e the Servants hector.That she might o're the Se\del·v·add·r\vants hector
Don Carlos made her sole Director.
om.
om.
In half a week the Dame grew nice,
Got all things at the highest Price.
Now at the Table head she sits
Presented with the choicest Bits:
She look'd on Partridges with scorn
Except they tasted of the Corn:
A Haunch of Ven'son made her sweat
Unless it had the right Fumette:
Don Carlos earnestly would beg,
Dear Madam try this Pigeon's leg:
Was happy when he could prevail
To make Her only touch a Quail:
Thrô candle-light she view'd the Wine
To see that ev'ry Glass was fine.
At last grown prouder than the Devil
With feeding high, & Treatment civil,
Too soon arrives the dismal Day,
She must return to Ormond-\del·?h·add·k\ey.
\add·Don Carlos now began to find
His Med'cine work as he design'd\
As the Coach stopp'd, she look'd & swore
The Rascal had mistook the Door:

·\Alternative lines to "At entring you might see her stoop
Nor would the Door admit her Hoop" are:\At going in you saw her stoop_The narrow Entry \crush'd·overwriting·brush'd?\ her Hoop.At entring you might see her stoop
Nor would the Door admit her Hoop.
om.
om.
om.
om.
om.
om.
\add She curs'd the dark & winding Stairs
And still encreasing in her Airs
Began a thousand faults to spy
The Cieling hardly six foot high
The smoaky Wainscot full of cracks
And half the Chairs with broken backs.
The Cubbard fasten'd with a Peg
The rusty Tongs have lost a Leg
Her Quarter's out at Lady Day
She'll have 'em know she scorns to stay
(While there are Houses to be let)
In Lodgings like a poor Grisette.\
·\Alternative·reading·to·"Howere·to·keep":\Mean time to keep.How\ere·overwriting·?·add·?\ to keep her Spirits up
om.
·\Alternative reading to "She sent":\She sends.She sent for Company to sup,
om.
·\Alternative reading to "When all":\Where all.When all the while you might remark
om.
·\Alternative reading to "She did her best to ape":\She strove in vain to ape.She did her best to ape Woodpark.
om.
Two Bottles call'd for, (half her Store,
The Cellar could contain but four)
A Supper worthy of her self,
Five Nothings \del·o·add·i\n five Plates of Delf.

\del·And·thus·the·Farce·a·fortnight·went
When·all·her·little·Money·spent,_add·Thus for a week the Farce went on
om.
om.
When the whole month's Allowance gone\
She fell into her former Scene,
Small Beer, a Herring, and the Dean.
\add·Since I must laugh, or cannot live,
Good-natur'd Stella will forgive:
We Poets when a Hint is new
Regard not what is false or true;
No Raillery gives just Offence
Where Truth has not the least Pretence;
Nor can be more securely plac't
Then on a Nymph of Stella's Tast.
I must confess your Wine and Vittle
I was too hard upon────·· a little
And you must know in what I writ
I had some Anger in my Wit.
For when you sigh to leave Woodpark,
The Place, the Welcome, and the Spark,
To languish in this odious Town,
And pull your haughty Stomach down,
You shew Don Carlos where to dwell,
And grieve he ever left Pell-mell.
Yet granting all I said were true,
A Cottage is Woodpark with You.\
